overview_of_class:
A Levantine Arabic course is open to both undergraduate and graduate students, and to students with some background in Arabic. The course is introduced on one quarter during an academic year. ?This course is an in-depth introduction to conversation and culture in the Arab World with concentration on developing speaking and communication skills in spoken Levantine colloquial Arabic. Recognizing that students may have somewhat different backgrounds, the course aims to ensure that each individual student progresses in speaking and comprehension across the quarter, relative to his/her initial level.

Please note, this course does not count toward the WCAS Foreign Language requirement and does not replace Arabic 111-3.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Successful completion of Arabic 111-1 with grade "B" or higher, or instructor consent.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Reading selections, workbook pages, and films on various topics are also drawn from different sources. Samples of classical Arabic literature are brought in for cultural enrichment, but contemporary Arabic writing (newspapers, literature) is also included to support building as strong communicative skills. These include Class discussion, participation, role-play scenarios, reinforced in-class dialogs and readings. . Classes will meet for 3 hours weekly.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Assessment of progress will be done by means of Attendance and participation, presentations, and final oral speaking exam.
